बमोजिम संस्थामा प्रचलित सञ्चालित कानून आवश्यकताको स्वस्थ्य
विद्यार्थीलाई आवश्यक मनोसामाजिक परामर्श सेवाको व्यवस्था गर्ने
दिवा खाजा खर्च बापतको रकम २५ बमोजिम सार्वजनिक उपलब्ध गराउनेः ऐनको दफा २२.
मन्त्रालयबाट निर्धारण भए बमोजिमको दैनिक विद्यालयमा
दैनिक दिवा  खाजा दरमा दिवा वापतको रकम स्थानीय तह   मार्फत
यस   नियमावली बमोजिमको छात्रवृत्ति सुविधा   दोहोरो गरी लिन नपाइनेः ऐन
शीर्षकमा दोहोरो पर्ने गरी कुनै रकम, सामाग्री वा एउटै विशेष व्यवस्था वा अवसर वापत
summary: The text discusses the regulations related to free education in Nepal, as per the Free Education Regulations, 2077. It outlines the mandatory provisions set by the Nepalese government under the Education Act, 2075. The regulations focus on literacy programs, educational access for underprivileged citizens, and the issuance of literacy certificates by local authorities. Additionally, it emphasizes the importance of providing educational facilities and support to children, especially those facing physical or mental challenges.

summary: The text discusses the regulations related to the management of property of telecommunications service providers whose licenses have been revoked in Nepal. It mentions amendments to the regulations and the authority of the government to make rules under the Telecommunications Act of 2053. The document outlines definitions and procedures for managing the assets of revoked service providers, including the duration of licenses and the process for public notification in case of revocation.

summary: The text discusses various legal amendments related to Nepal's tax laws, including the Anticorruption Act of 2058, the Strengthening and Consolidation Act of 2066, and the Economic Act of 2075. These laws aim to streamline tax collection processes, enhance revenue management, and regulate financial activities. The Anticorruption Act of 2058 specifically focuses on imposing internal taxes for economic development. Additionally, the text highlights the importance of obtaining permits for the production and distribution of goods and services, as well as the establishment of authorized entities for tax compliance.

summary: The text discusses the amendments made to the Customs Rules in Nepal, published in the Nepal Gazette. The amendments range from 2059 to 2080, with various changes and updates to the rules over the years. The document outlines the progression of amendments and the authority of the government to make changes to the Customs Rules.

summary: The text discusses the International Center for Integrated Mountain Development Act, 2040, which aims to strengthen and develop the mountainous regions through research and collaboration. It establishes legal provisions for the operation of the center in Nepal, allowing for international cooperation and independent management. The Act also outlines the structure and functions of the center, emphasizing its autonomous and self-governing nature. Additionally, it addresses the center's funding sources and operational guidelines.
